item.title: 波音公司报告亏损 118 亿美元，创 2020 年以来最大亏损额
item.description: 波音公司周二报告年度亏损 118.3 亿美元，创下 2020 年以来的最大亏损额，原因是该公司正努力解决其商业和国防部门的问题，以及美国西海岸工厂工人瘫痪性罢工造成的影响。【原文：Boeing on Tuesday reported an annual loss of $11.83 billion, its largest since 2020, as it grappled with problems at its commercial and defense units and the fallout from a crippling strike by U.S. West Coast factory workers.】

item.title: RTX 因飞机零部件和维修需求强劲而实现季度利润增长
item.description: 本周二，航空航天和防务巨头 RTX 公布季度利润增长，原因是航空公司为应对喷气式飞机短缺问题而改飞维护密集的老旧飞机，从而使对其飞机零部件和维修服务的需求受益。【原文：Aerospace and defense major RTX posted a rise in quarterly profit on Tuesday, as demand for its aircraft parts and repair services benefited from airlines flying older, maintenance-intensive planes to cope with a jet shortage.】

item.title: 巴西政府支持 Gol-Azul 合并以加强航空业
item.description: 巴西港口和机场部长告诉路透社，巴西 Gol 航空公司和 Azul 航空公司计划合并，这将加强巴西航空业，防止任何一家公司倒闭。【原文：A planned merger between Brazilian airlines Gol and Azul would strengthen the sector and prevent either company from failing, Brazil's ports and airports minister told Reuters, giving the potential move a key government nod.】

item.title: 金佰利公司预测年度利润增长强劲
item.description: 金佰利公司周二预测年度调整后利润增长将超过华尔街预期，并公布了好于预期的季度销售额，因为该公司是 Kleenex 纸巾生产商，受益于需求复苏。【原文：Kimberly-Clark forecast annual adjusted profit growth ahead of Wall Street estimates and reported better-than-expected quarterly sales on Tuesday as the Kleenex tissue maker benefited from a recovery in demand.】

item.title: 在对 DeepSeek 和特朗普的希望与担忧中，ASML 发布第四季度财报
item.description: 尽管中国的 DeepSeek 引发了抛售，但作为最大的计算机芯片制造设备供应商，ASML 将于周三公布财报，投资者将寻求保证，ASML 2025 年依赖人工智能的增长前景是安全的。【原文：Investors will seek reassurance that ASML's AI-dependent growth outlook for 2025 is secure despite a selloff sparked by China's DeepSeek, as the biggest supplier of equipment used to make computer chips ASML reports earnings on Wednesday.】

item.title: 皇家加勒比预计 2025 年盈利强劲，邮轮旅游需求旺盛
item.description: 本周二，皇家加勒比公司预测其年度利润将大大高于华尔街的预期，该公司将赌注押在了私人目的地游轮以及地中海和阿拉斯加地区高端航程预订量的增加上。【原文：Royal Caribbean forecast its annual profit largely above Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, betting on higher cruise bookings to private destinations as well as premium voyages to the Mediterranean and the Alaskan region.】

item.title: 得益于汽油卡车和 SUV，通用汽车业绩和预测均高于华尔街目标
item.description: 通用汽车公司周二公布了 2024 年第四季度财报，2025 年盈利预期超出华尔街预期，原因是这家美国汽车制造商继续看到消费者对其价格昂贵的汽油动力卡车和 SUV 的强劲需求。【原文：General Motors on Tuesday posted fourth-quarter 2024 results and a 2025 earnings forecast ahead of Wall Street expectations as the U.S. automaker continued to see strong consumer demand for its pricey gasoline-powered trucks and SUVs.】

item.title: 人工智能支出疑云重重，微软云计算增长成焦点
item.description: 几个月来，微软一直在吹捧其 Azure 云业务的反弹，周三的季度收入预测将显示，对人工智能的数十亿美元押注是否推动了其主要利润引擎的增长。【原文：Microsoft has spent months touting a rebound in its Azure cloud business and its quarterly revenue forecast on Wednesday will show whether billion-dollar bets on artificial intelligence are propelling increased growth in its main profit engine.】

item.title: 人工智能冲击后的深呼吸，特朗普关税的隆隆声
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 特朗普政策和美联储前景不明朗，美国债券投资者寻求安全
item.description: 由于特朗普政府政策影响的不确定性，以及有迹象表明美联储的降息政策可能会长期暂停，美国债券投资者正在为波动加剧做好准备，并在投资组合中保持防御性。【原文：U.S. bond investors are gearing up for increased volatility and staying defensive in their portfolios amid uncertainty about the impact of the Trump administration's policies and signs that the Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts may be on a lengthy pause.】

item.title: 压裂需求下滑，美国油田公司面临定价压力
item.description: 据油田高管和分析师称，由于石油生产商的效率越来越高，并限制支出，美国顶级油田服务公司今年将面临定价和收入疲软的局面。【原文：Top U.S. oilfield services firms are facing weaker pricing and revenue this year as oil producers become increasingly efficient and keep a cap on spending, according to oilfield executives and analysts.】

item.title: 标普、纳斯达克期货在科技股大跌后收复失地
item.description: 周二，美国 500 指数和纳斯达克指数期货走高，此前一个交易日，中国低成本人工智能模型大受欢迎，导致投资该技术的美国公司股价大幅下跌。【原文：Futures tied to the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq were higher on Tuesday after steep losses in the previous session, when the popularity of a low-cost Chinese artificial intelligence model rattled stocks of U.S. companies invested in the technology.】

item.title: 大众汽车首席执行官确认与中国合资伙伴就投资德国工厂进行会谈
item.description: 大众汽车公司首席执行官奥利弗-布卢姆（Oliver Blume）在周二的一次会议上告诉路透社记者，在路透社报道中国投资者有意收购德国工厂之后，大众汽车公司及其中国合作伙伴已经讨论了他们在德国投资建厂的可能性。【原文：Volkswagen and its Chinese partners have discussed the possibility of them investing in plants in Germany, VW Chief Executive Oliver Blume told Reuters at a conference on Tuesday, after Reuters reported that Chinese investors were interested in buying up German factories.】

item.title: 特朗普对芯片和药品征收关税将打击美国在亚洲的盟友
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，他计划对进口计算机芯片、药品和钢铁征收关税，以推动企业在美国生产更多产品。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump plans to impose tariffs on imported computer chips, pharmaceuticals and steel, he said on Monday, to push companies to manufacture more in the United States.】

item.title: 散户投资者在 DeepSeek 崩溃中买入创纪录数量的英伟达股票
item.description: 在对中国初创公司 DeepSeek 的低成本人工智能模型感到担忧之后，散户投资者周一买入了创纪录数量的英伟达股票，使其股价下跌了 17%，市值减少了 5930 亿美元。【原文：Retail investors bought a record amount of Nvidia stock on Monday after concerns over a low-cost artificial intelligence model from Chinese startup DeepSeek stripped 17% off its shares, or $593 billion from its market value.】

item.title: 日经新闻》称日本本田有望在北美推出售价低于 3 万美元的电动汽车
item.description: 日本《日经新闻》周二称，日本本田汽车公司计划最早于2026年在北美推出一款售价低于3万美元的小型电动汽车，以在电池动力汽车市场迎头赶上。【原文：Japan's Honda Motor plans to launch a small electric vehicle priced below $30,000 in North America by as early as 2026, the Nikkei newspaper said on Tuesday, as it plays catch-up in the battery-powered car market.】

item.title: 谷歌告诉欧盟法院，创纪录的 45 亿美元欧盟罚款是对其创新的惩罚
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司周二向欧洲最高法院表示，七年前欧盟对谷歌处以 43 亿欧元（45 亿美元）的创纪录反垄断罚款，是对这家科技巨头创新能力的惩罚，该公司要求法官撤销欧盟的决定。【原文：A record EU antitrust fine of 4.3-billion-euro ($4.5 billion) imposed on Google seven years ago punished the tech giant over its innovation, the Alphabet unit told Europe's top court on Tuesday, as it asked judges to scrap the EU decision.】

item.title: 据消息人士称，汉莎航空正在与欧洲航空商谈收购少数股权事宜
item.description: 据两位知情人士透露，德国汉莎航空公司（Lufthansa）正在与西班牙航空公司欧洲航空（Air Europa）就收购少数股权的可能性进行谈判。【原文：German airline group Lufthansa is in talks with Spanish carrier Air Europa about the possibility of acquiring a minority stake, according to two sources with knowledge of the talks.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴蔡崇信支持的公司收购意大利奢侈运动鞋制造商金鹅公司 12% 的股份
item.description: 由阿里巴巴联合创始人蔡崇信（Joe Tsai）支持的香港投资公司蓝池（Blue Pool）周二表示，已收购意大利奢侈运动鞋制造商金鹅（Golden Goose）12%的股份。【原文：Blue Pool, a Hong Kong-based investment firm backed by Alibaba co-founder Joe Tsai, has bought a 12% stake in Italian luxury sneaker maker Golden Goose, the Venice-based brand said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 德国工业游说团（BDI）称德国深陷经济危机
item.description: 德国 BDI 工业协会周二表示，德国正深陷经济危机，预计 2025 年国内生产总值将萎缩 0.1%。【原文：Germany is in a deep economic crisis, Germany's BDI industry association said on Tuesday, forecasting a 0.1% contraction in gross domestic product in 2025.】

item.title: Mediobanca 董事会开会讨论收购事宜，MPS 股价进一步下滑
item.description: 周二，Mediobanca 董事会聚集在一起讨论这家规模较小的竞争对手出人意料的出价，Monte dei Paschi 的股票进一步下跌，这是意大利银行业一系列收购风波中的最新举措。【原文：Shares in Monte dei Paschi fell further on Tuesday as the board of Mediobanca gathered to discuss a surprise bid by the smaller rival, the latest move in a series of takeover tussles rattling Italian banking.】

item.title: 育碧将关闭英国分部并重组其他三个分部，185 名员工将受影响
item.description: 法国最大的视频游戏制造商育碧公司周二表示，将关闭其在英国的莱明顿工厂，并重组育碧杜塞尔多夫工厂、育碧斯德哥尔摩工厂和育碧映像工厂的业务，这将影响到 185 名员工，证实了此前媒体的报道。【原文：France's largest video game maker Ubisoft will close its Leamington site in Britain and restructure operations at Ubisoft Düsseldorf, Ubisoft Stockholm and Ubisoft Reflections, impacting 185 employees, it said on Tuesday, confirming earlier media reports.】

item.title: 独家：备忘录显示，汇丰将缩减欧洲、英国和美洲的并购和企业内容管理能力
item.description: 周二的一份备忘录显示，作为投资银行业务重大调整的一部分，汇丰银行正准备关闭其在欧洲、英国和美洲的并购和股票资本市场业务。【原文：HSBC is preparing to wind down its M&A and equity capital markets businesses in Europe, the UK and the Americas as part of a major shake-up of its investment banking operations, a memo showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 应对特朗普关税威胁，台湾称芯片业务是 "双赢 "之举
item.description: 针对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发出的关税威胁，台湾经济部周二表示，台湾和美国之间的半导体业务具有高度互补性，对双方来说都是 "双赢 "模式。【原文：Semiconductor business between Taiwan and the United States is a "win-win" model for both sides given the high level of complementarity, the island's economy ministry said on Tuesday responding to tariff threats from U.S. President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 瓦克化学核心利润因价格下降和能源成本高企而下降
item.description: 德国化学公司瓦克化学周二报告称，其年度核心利润同比下降了 7%，原因是价格和销量下降，特别是太阳能级多晶硅的价格和销量下降，以及德国能源成本居高不下。【原文：German chemical company Wacker Chemie reported a 7% fall year-on-year in its annual core profit on Tuesday, citing lower prices and sales volumes, particularly for solar-grade polysilicon, as well as high energy costs in Germany.】

item.title: 欧洲银行或难再现年末强劲表现
item.description: 欧洲银行预计将公布去年最后三个月的利润大幅增长，这主要得益于贷款利润率依然强劲以及投资银行业务收入大增。【原文：European banks are expected to report a sharp rise in profits for the final three months of last year, helped by still-robust margins from lending and bumper investment banking revenues.】

item.title: 范围》称，德国必须解决结构性弱点才能保持 AAA 评级
item.description: 欧洲评级机构 Scope Ratings 执行董事 Eiko Sievert 在接受路透社采访时说，德国要想长期保持 AAA 信用评级，就必须克服结构性弱点。【原文：Germany needs to overcome its structural weaknesses if it wants to keep its AAA credit rating in the long term, Eiko Sievert, executive director at European ratings agency, Scope Ratings, told Reuters in an interview.】

item.title: 费城全食超市工人投票成立工会
item.description: 周一，宾夕法尼亚州费城全食超市一家旗舰店的大多数工人投票决定成立工会，成为亚马逊旗下食品连锁店中第一个取得劳工胜利的连锁店。【原文：A majority of workers at a flagship Whole Foods store in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania voted to unionize on Monday, becoming the first in the Amazon-owned grocery chain to snatch a labor victory.】

item.title: 美国科技股暴跌凸显市场依赖巨头的风险
item.description: 一些最大科技公司的动荡提醒投资者，美国股市创纪录的涨势面临一个主要风险：依赖少数几家巨型公司推动股市上涨。【原文：Turbulence in some of the biggest tech names is reminding investors of one of the major risks to the U.S. stock market's record-setting rally: Reliance on a handful of mammoth companies to power those gains.】

item.title: 前政策制定者称，日本央行将在 7 月前再次加息，最终有望将利率上调至 1.5
item.description: 日本央行前董事会成员樱井诚（Makoto Sakurai）周二表示，日本央行可能会在6月或7月左右再次加息，并寻求在未来两年内将政策利率至少上调至1.5%。【原文：The Bank of Japan will likely raise interest rates again around June or July, and seek to hike its policy rate to at least 1.5% in the next two years, former BOJ board member Makoto Sakurai said on Tuesday.】
